START.name: Halloween Night

enterText.first:
Welcome to The Radley House!

This is a text based game where you wander around and try to discover things.

----------------------------------------------------------

It is late on Halloween night and twilight is creeping in. All along the street the porchlights are off, as if the dark houses are saying 'enough is enough'.

It looks like Halloween is officially over.....

... wait? is that a light on over there? Just down the street, to the east?

[hint: type go east to walk down the street.]
enterText.repeat: You are at the start of your Halloween adventure. The street continues to the east towards Mrs. McGillicutty's house.

START.lookText: It is Halloween night and getting dark. You can see some houses down the street to the east.

STREET-01.name: Street

enterText.first:
You walk east to investigate the light. Why, it's Mrs. McGillicutty's house! Cheery house. Nice of her to leave the porch light on. Probably has some candy left!

Wow, she really went all out on the decorations this year! Fancy Halloween lighting! Those ghosts are old school! Her well-lit front porch is to the north. The sidewalk continues to the east or back to the west.

[hint: in this game you will type commands (like north) and sometimes two word commands (like get key) to control your player. Words in bold will often be commands or words you can type.]
enterText.repeat: You are on the street. The path to Mrs. McGillicutty's house is to the north. The sidewalk continues to the east or back to the west.

STREET-01.lookText:
You are on the street. Mrs. McGillicutty's front porch is to the north. The sidewalk continues to the east, or back to the west. It is getting darker.

[Hint: type 'go north' to Mrs. McGillicutty's porch, or 'go east' to head on down the road.]

STREET-02.name: Street

enterText.first:
You walk down the street to THE RADLEY HOUSE.

Such an imposing decrepit old house! Sort of a cross between the Addams Family mansion and Notre Dame Cathedral. Gothic!

To the north is the Radley's front porch. or... maybe it would be safer to just walk west, back to Mrs. McGillicutty's house?
enterText.repeat: You are in front of the Radley House again. Its not so bad once you get used to it.... if you're a ghost!

STREET-02.lookText: You are in front of the Radley House again. Its not so bad once you get used to it I guess.

NICE-PORCH.name: Nice Porch

enterText.first:
You are standing on Mrs. McGillicutty's porch. The porch light is on, casting a warm welcoming glow.

[hint: type ring doorbell or use doorbell to ring the doorbell, or type examine doorbell to get more information about it.]

[hint: Use look to remind you of where you are.]
enterText.second: The porch light is off. The porch is dark, but you can still make out the doorbell.
enterText.repeat: The porch light is off. The porch is dark, but you can still make out the doorbell.

NICE-PORCH.lookText: You are on Mrs. McGillicutty's porch. The front door is north and the pathway to the street is south.

NICE-HOUSE.name: Nice House

enterText.first:
NOTE THIS IS NOW IN THE ITEMS - THIS IS LEFT HERE TO REMIND ME. The door to the nice house swings open. Mrs. McGillicutty answers. Her face is painted green, and she is wearing a pointy witch hat. 'Elphaba!' you think? She holds a small candy dish, and tells you to take two candies.

After you take the candies she leans over and whispers 'Mr. Radley and his son Arthur next door are having a scavenger hunt. You might find this note useful during that game!'

She hands you a handwritten note and you put it in your pocket. [hint: type examine list to read Mrs. McGillicutty's clues.] 'Good luck dear!' she says, and closes the door.
enterText.second: The porchlight is off. You ring and ring, but no one answers.
enterText.repeat: The porchlight is off. You ring and ring, but no one answers.

NICE-HOUSE.lookText: You are still on the porch.

FRONT-PORCH.name: Front Porch

enterText.first:
You go up the walkway to the front porch of the Radley House. The porchlight is dirty yellow, flickering. Not a soul in sight. There is a brass gong handle to the right of the door.

[hint: type use gong or use handle to sound the gong.]
enterText.repeat: You are on the Radley's front porch. Porchlight still flickering and buzzing. The gong handle is very ornate. What!! Is that a rat?

FRONT-PORCH.lookText: You are on the Radley's front porch. The door's gong handle is right in front of you. The porch is barely lit, dank, and spooky. Entry into the house is to the north. The sidewalk is behind you to the south.

TV-ROOM.name: TV ROOM

enterText.first:
You enter the TV ROOM. A large flat-screen TV mounted on the wall is playing a show - the 2016 Netflix series 'Stranger Things.' On the screen, kids on bikes are racing through a dark forest, flashlights cutting through the fog.

Against the opposite wall stands an elegant wooden cabinet with glass doors. Through the glass, you can see shelves lined with DVD cases. Your eyes are drawn to a DVD of 'Stranger Things' on the second shelf. Wait... how is the show playing if the DVD is right there in the cabinet? [hint: you could try to open cabinet.]
enterText.repeat: You are in the TV ROOM. The show is still playing on the TV, and the DVD cabinet stands against the wall.

TV-ROOM.lookText: You are in the TV ROOM. A large TV is mounted on one wall, currently playing 'Stranger Things.' An elegant DVD cabinet with glass doors stands against the opposite wall.

HOME.name: Home

enterText.first:
=========================================================
You walk home. It's great to be able to rest after all that trick-or-treating. You can't wait to gorge on all those sweet treats! This was your final haul:
enterText.second: .........  That's about it for this game.  Nothing more to do here.  You might as well choose another mini-game and go have some fun!
enterText.repeat: You are home.  The game is over.  Choose another mini-game.

HOME.lookText: You are home.  The game is over.  Choose another mini-game.
